catalogue_raissonne: Hollstein 2; Bartsch 2 (vol. 8, p. 321); Landau 2a (with the fine line demarcating the table edge still visible on the overhanging cloth)
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: three angels sitting at a round table at L of image, looking at a male figure to the R of the table who appears to be grabbing a plate; bowl on ground in front of table; woman at R entering scene from arched door
inscription:
Signature, Title

in graphite on verso: [an apparent sketch] | SUMICo | B2
portfolio: From the Story of Abraham, Plate 2
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram and title in plate, top center: [ABRAHAM. PG]
text: In depicting Abraham’s heavenly guests (Genesis 18:2-10), Georg Pencz took the unusual step of having a divine being touch Abraham, illustrating the Protestant idea of God’s presence in everyday life. The scene also reminded viewers of faith rewarded, because the angels tell Abraham that he and his aged wife, Sarah, seen in the doorway, will be given a son.
title: Abraham Entertaining the Angels, From the Story of Abraham, Plate 2
